title: Adobe Campaign ExperienceEvent Extension

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/campaign.title: A single message sent to a recipient.

xdm:profile.title: Profile
xdm:profile.description: The recipient of the message. This property is primarily used to link the message to a Profile using the `EndCustomerID` but it can also be used to freeze some properties of the profile at the time the message was sent.

xdm:variant.title: Content Variant
xdm:variant.description:
A campaign activity can have multiple variants e.g. Multilingual (translated variants for the same content) or A/B testing (different content to test what works better) but a message delivered to a recipient always contains one of them.
> IMPORTANT: In case of multilingual, the mirror page, the recipient can switch from one variant to another (ex: switch of the language).

xdm:seedMember.title: Seed Member
xdm:seedMember.description: The recipient of this message is a member of a seed list for this campaign activity. Seed addresses are used to include recipients who do not match the defined target criteria. Seed members could be your marketing team or other stakeholders who are interested in tracking/measuring the quality of the campaign. SeedMembers get the actual message, at the same time with regular recipients, even when the seedMember does not qualify to be a regular recipient.

xdm:quarantine.title: Quarantine
xdm:quarantine.description: Address moved to quarantine. The quarantine is set to `true` when the message failed to deliver in a way that indicates that no future messages will be deliverable either to this address.

xdm:proofMember.title: Proof Member
xdm:proofMember.description: The recipient of this message is a member of the proof group for this campaign activity. The proof is a special message that lets you test a delivery before sending to the main target. Proof recipients are responsible for approving both the form and content of the message. It is a pre-delivery target.

xdm:controlGroupMember.title: Control Group Member
xdm:controlGroupMember.description: The recipient of this message is a member of a control group for this campaign activity. A control group is a population which will not receive the delivery; it is used to track post-delivery behavior and campaign impact by making a comparison between the control group (or hold out group) with the behavior of target population, which has received the delivery.

xdm:testMember.title: A/B Test Member
xdm:testMember.description: The recipient of this message is a member of a test group for this campaign activity. This is primarily used for identifying the initial population of an A/B Test. After sending different variants to the testMembers, the winner Variant is decided to be sent to the remaining population based on behavioural changes in testMembers.

xdm:size.title: Size (Bytes)
xdm:size.description:
Size in bytes of the message.
* For email, the `size` reflects the all MIME envelope of the message, including the encoded attachments if any.
* For SMS, the `size` reflects the number of bytes necessary to deliver the message.
If that number is over 160 the message will be delivered over more than one SMS.

xdm:reason.title: Reason

meta:enum.unknown_user: The address does not exist. There is no use sending deliveries to this address.
meta:enum.invalid_domain: The domain of the email address is incorrect or no longer exists.
meta:enum.unreachable: An error has occurred in the message delivery chain.These addresses can be removed from the quarantine list to make another attempt.
meta:enum.disabled: The user uses a messaging service which is accessible from the web. When the Internet Access Provider (IAP) detects a lengthy period of inactivity, it can close the user's account. Deliveries to the user's address will then be impossible.
meta:enum.mailbox_full: The recipient's mailbox contains too many messages. This address can be removed from the quarantine list to make another attempt.
meta:enum.not_connected: The recipient's mobile phone is switched off or not connected to the network when the message is sent.
meta:enum.refused: The address was rejected following the application of a security rule (e.g. by an anti-spam program)
meta:enum.error_ignored: The address is whitelisted and the message ignored.
meta:enum.address_undefined: No address is given for the recipient.
meta:enum.blacklisted: The address was blacklisted at the time of sending.
meta:enum.quarantine: The address was in quarantine at the time of sending.
meta:enum.duplicate: The address of the recipient was already in this campaign activity.
meta:enum.typology_rule: The recipient was excluded by a 'SQL' type campaign typology rule.
meta:enum.business_ranking: The recipient was excluded by an 'arbitration' type campaign typology rule
meta:enum.quality: The quality rating for this address is too low
meta:enum.over_delivery_limit: The campaign activity had more than allowed number of target profiles.
meta:enum.expired: The campaign activity exceeded the time duration to complete.

xdm:outboundIP.title: IP Address
xdm:outboundIP.description: Outbound IP address used to deliver the message.

xdm:externalID.title: External ID
xdm:externalID.description: An ID generated by the parent activity invoking service to check later if the incoming experienceEvent was generated using this ID.

xdm:id.title: Delivery ID
xdm:id.description: The campaign activity originating this message.

xdm:from.title: From
xdm:from.description:
Address used as a from/sender/caller address. Depending on the communication channel, the `address` has a different format.

  * `email`: an email address.
  * `textMessage` or `phone`: a shortcode or phone number.

xdm:testEnabled.title: Test Enabled
xdm:testEnabled.description: Specify whether campaign activity is of type A/B testing.

xdm:messageClass.title: Message Class
xdm:messageClass.description: Mode of delivery for the messages sent.

xdm:templateID.title: Identifier of the Template
xdm:templateID.description:
The delivery template's ID used to initialize this delivery.

The type the template used in Adobe Campaign can be identified using the `messageClass`.

* `messageClass` = `oneTime`: the template is standard delivery template.
* `messageClass` = `continuous`: the template is a recurring delivery.
* `messageClass` = `transactional`: the template is a transactionnal message template.

xdm:deliveryName.title: Delivery Internal name
xdm:deliveryName.description: A human-friendly identifier of the campaign activity which is originating this message.

xdm:occurrence.title: Occurrence
xdm:occurrence.description: URL occurrence index in the content (first is 1). When the same URL is available several times in the same content, its is necessary to track which occurrence of the URL has been clicked on.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/campaign.title: Campaign Orchestration for creating user journey.

xdm:businessReason.title: Business Reason
xdm:businessReason.description: Business qualifier that identifies the event sent by the data source. It informs on the business reason for sending the event. It is unique per organization. This is used by Campaign orchestration to identify the event without inspecting its payload to determine which action should be triggered when the event is received. The value of this field is a contract between Campaign orchestration and the data source.

orchestrationDetails.title: Orchestration Details
orchestrationDetails.description: Set of attributes that are associated with every orchestration.

journey.title: Journey for an entity
journey.description: Journey created by marketer for its entities.

journeyVersion.title: Journey Version for an entity
journeyVersion.description: Schema for describing the version of a journey, where version holds the state machine.

action.title: Action associated with a journey
action.description: Action that is executed for an entity when reached a step in in the journey state machine.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/campaign.title: Container identifier
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/campaign.description: The identifier denoting the container with which campaign experience event is associated.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/campaign.title: Mutated fields from the previous experienceEvent.
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/campaign.description: Information of the fields that have changed since the previous experienceevent to keep track of the state changes across events. For e.g. if when an email gets sent, an experienceEvent with metric `sends` will be sent. This may get bounced and an experienceEvent with metric `bounces` will be sent then. It may be important for a downstream application to know that the previous experienceEvent with metric `sends` is now to be invalidated. This field will contain the values from the previous experienceEvent that have a different value in the current experienceEvent.
